page.title: 16The Plume School
page.content: The Plume-an amalgamation of Maldon Grammar and Secondary schools- originated as Maldon Grammar School in 1407 on the site where the library is today. It moved to its present site in Fambridge Road in 1907.In 1971 it became comprehensive and was renamed The Plume School after the late Dr. Thomas Plume. Today the Plume is located in two separate buildings-the Lower School and the Upper School. The Lower School,which used to be the Secondary Modern in Wantz Road,houses all First and Second Year pupils.The Upper in Fambridge Road, houses years Three to Six. The school has about 2100 pupils making it one of the largest in England.The school takes its badge from the Maldon Town badge which shows 3 lions rampant and a ship. By Simon Mott 2S2
